title: 2 John Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 John chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 John Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 John Chapter 1.

questions.question: To whom is the elder writing in 2 John 1:1?
options: The elect lady and her children
questions.correctAnswer: The elect lady and her children
questions.explanation: The elder addresses the elect lady and her children in 2 John 1:1.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:3, grace, mercy, and peace come from whom?
options: God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 2 John 1:3 states that grace, mercy, and peace come from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What is the reason the elder rejoiced in 2 John 1:4?
options: Because he found the children walking in truth
Because the elect lady sent gifts
Because the elders gathered in unity
questions.correctAnswer: Because he found the children walking in truth
questions.explanation: The elder rejoiced greatly that he found the children walking in truth according to 2 John 1:4.

questions.question: What commandment does the elder remind the lady of in 2 John 1:5?
options: That we fast twice a week
questions.correctAnswer: That we love one another
questions.explanation: The elder reminds the lady of the commandment to love one another in 2 John 1:5.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:6, what is love?
questions.correctAnswer: To walk after His commandments
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:6 explains that love is to walk after His commandments.

questions.question: Who does 2 John 1:7 warn about?
options: Many deceivers who do not confess Jesus Christ came in the flesh
Those who do not attend synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: Many deceivers who do not confess Jesus Christ came in the flesh
questions.explanation: Verse 2 John 1:7 warns about deceivers who deny Jesus Christ came in the flesh.

questions.question: What does 2 John 1:8 advise believers to do?
options: Look to yourselves, that you do not lose what you have wrought
questions.correctAnswer: Look to yourselves, that you do not lose what you have wrought
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:8 advises believers to be careful not to lose what they have worked for.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:9, who has both the Father and the Son?
options: He that abides in the doctrine of Christ
He that gives to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: He that abides in the doctrine of Christ
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:9 states that one who abides in the doctrine of Christ has both the Father and the Son.

questions.question: What does 2 John 1:10 instruct about those who bring not the doctrine of Christ?
options: Do not receive them into your house nor bid them God speed
questions.correctAnswer: Do not receive them into your house nor bid them God speed
questions.explanation: Verse 2 John 1:10 instructs not to receive or greet those who do not bring the doctrine of Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:11, what happens if you bid God speed to those who bring false doctrine?
options: You are partaker of their evil deeds
questions.correctAnswer: You are partaker of their evil deeds
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:11 states that bidding God speed to such persons makes you a partaker of their evil deeds.

questions.question: Who greets the elect lady in 2 John 1:13?
options: The children of thy elect sister
questions.correctAnswer: The children of thy elect sister
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:13 mentions that the children of the elect sister greet the elect lady.

questions.question: True or False: 2 John 1:2 says that the truth shall be with us forever.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:2 states the truth dwells in us and shall be with us forever.

questions.question: True or False: 2 John 1:12 says the elder preferred to write with paper and ink rather than visit in person.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:12 says the elder chose not to write with paper and ink but hoped to visit and speak face to face.

questions.question: True or False: 2 John 1:6 says the commandment is to walk in love as heard from the beginning.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:6 confirms that love is to walk after His commandments, as heard from the beginning.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 John 1:3: 'Grace be with you, mercy, and ______, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.'
questions.correctAnswer: peace
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:3 includes grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

medium.title: 2 John Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 John Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 John 1:5-6 teach us about love in practical Christian living?
options: Love is walking according to God's commandments
Love is only about feelings and emotions
Love is keeping to ourselves and not sharing
questions.correctAnswer: Love is walking according to God's commandments
questions.explanation: Verses 5-6 emphasize that love is demonstrated by obeying God's commandments and walking in truth, showing that true love involves action and obedience, not just emotions.

questions.question: A fellow believer is concerned about false teaching in the church. Based on 2 John 1:7, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Many deceivers do not confess Jesus Christ came in the flesh
False teaching should be ignored silently
Jesus Christ's coming in the flesh is not important
questions.correctAnswer: Many deceivers do not confess Jesus Christ came in the flesh
questions.explanation: Verse 7 warns about deceivers who deny Jesus Christ's incarnation, calling them antichrists, highlighting the importance of guarding the true doctrine of Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:3, what blessings are prayed for from God the Father and Jesus Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace, mercy, and peace
questions.explanation: Verse 3 specifically offers grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, emphasizing spiritual blessings essential for Christian life.

questions.question: What does 2 John 1:9 teach about those who do not abide in the doctrine of Christ?
options: They are still accepted by God
questions.correctAnswer: They have not God
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states that anyone who transgresses and does not remain in the doctrine of Christ does not have God, stressing the vital importance of holding to true teaching.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to welcome a teacher who denies Christ’s incarnation. Based on 2 John 1:10-11, what action should be taken?
options: Do not receive them into your house or greet them
Welcome them warmly to avoid conflict
Invite them to share more about their views
questions.correctAnswer: Do not receive them into your house or greet them
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 advise rejecting anyone who does not bring the true doctrine of Christ and warn that supporting such a person makes one partaker of evil deeds.

questions.question: How does 2 John 1:4 encourage believers in their daily walk of faith?
options: Rejoicing when others walk in truth
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoicing when others walk in truth
questions.explanation: Verse 4 expresses joy when hearing that fellow believers are walking in truth, encouraging mutual encouragement and accountability in faith.

questions.question: What does 2 John 1:8 warn believers to be careful about in their service to God?
options: Not losing the work already done
questions.correctAnswer: Not losing the work already done
questions.explanation: Verse 8 urges believers to look to themselves so they do not lose what they have worked for, highlighting perseverance and faithfulness in service.

questions.question: What hope does the elder express in 2 John 1:12 regarding his communication with the elect lady?
options: To speak face to face for fuller joy
To send more letters by mail
questions.correctAnswer: To speak face to face for fuller joy
questions.explanation: Verse 12 reveals the elder's desire to visit and speak personally so that their joy may be complete, showing the value of personal fellowship.

questions.question: How does 2 John 1:2 describe the nature of truth in the believer’s life?
options: Truth dwells in us and remains forever
Truth is a private matter only
Truth is a burden to carry
questions.correctAnswer: Truth dwells in us and remains forever
questions.explanation: Verse 2 teaches that truth lives within believers and will continue to be with them forever, emphasizing its enduring and indwelling character.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 John 1:1, the elder writes only to the elect lady and not to any others who know the truth.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states the elder writes to the elect lady and her children, whom he loves in the truth, and also to all who have known the truth, indicating a broader audience.

questions.question: True or False: 2 John 1:6 teaches that love consists of walking after God's commandments as we have heard from the beginning.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 6 clearly states that love is demonstrated by walking in obedience to God's commandments, which believers have heard from the beginning.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 2 John 1:11 warns that whoever bids a deceiver 'God speed' becomes a __________ of his evil deeds.
questions.correctAnswer: partaker
questions.explanation: Verse 11 teaches that approving or encouraging a deceiver makes one a partner or partaker in their evil actions, emphasizing the seriousness of supporting false teaching.

questions.question: Based on 2 John 1:13, how is fellowship expressed among believers?
questions.correctAnswer: Through greetings from fellow believers
questions.explanation: Verse 13 shows the children of the elect sister send greetings, highlighting the importance of maintaining fellowship through mutual encouragement.

questions.question: How does 2 John 1:9 relate obedience to God with adherence to Christ’s doctrine?
options: He who abides in Christ’s doctrine has both the Father and the Son
Doctrine is less important than feelings
One can have God without following Christ’s doctrine
questions.correctAnswer: He who abides in Christ’s doctrine has both the Father and the Son
questions.explanation: Verse 9 teaches that abiding in the doctrine of Christ is essential to having a relationship with both the Father and the Son, linking doctrine with true fellowship.

questions.question: What is the reason given in 2 John 1:5 for not writing a new commandment?
options: Because the commandment to love one another comes from the beginning
Because commandments are no longer needed
Because the elder was unsure of the teaching
Because love is only a feeling
questions.correctAnswer: Because the commandment to love one another comes from the beginning
questions.explanation: Verse 5 explains that the commandment to love one another is not new but has been known from the beginning, underscoring continuity in Christian teaching.

hard.title: 2 John Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 John Chapter 1.

questions.question: In 2 John 1:1, to whom is the elder writing, and what is the significance of the phrase 'whom I love in the truth'?
options: The elect lady and her children, emphasizing genuine love grounded in truth
A local church in Ephesus, highlighting communal worship
The apostles in Jerusalem, stressing doctrinal unity
The Gentile believers, focusing on faith without works
questions.correctAnswer: The elect lady and her children, emphasizing genuine love grounded in truth
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:1 identifies the recipient as the 'elect lady and her children,' indicating a specific group or person beloved in the truth, emphasizing the importance of love that is rooted in doctrinal truth.

questions.question: What is the central theme expressed in 2 John 1:5-6 regarding the commandment mentioned?
options: Love one another as the fundamental commandment to be obeyed
Strict adherence to dietary laws as the sign of faithfulness
Observance of the Sabbath as the new commandment
Faith alone without works as the basis of salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Love one another as the fundamental commandment to be obeyed
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 6 emphasize that the commandment, not new but from the beginning, is to love one another, and that love is demonstrated by walking in His commandments.

questions.question: 2 John 1:7 warns about deceivers who 'confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh.' What theological heresy does this address?
options: Docetism, which denies Christ's true humanity
questions.correctAnswer: Docetism, which denies Christ's true humanity
questions.explanation: The phrase about those who do not confess Jesus Christ came in the flesh directly counters Docetism, a heresy denying Jesus' real incarnation, as stated in 2 John 1:7.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:9, what is the consequence for one who does not abide in the doctrine of Christ?
options: He is condemned by the church elders
questions.correctAnswer: He hath not God
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:9 clearly states that whoever transgresses and does not abide in the doctrine of Christ does not have God, indicating the gravity of holding correct doctrine.

questions.question: What instruction does 2 John 1:10 give concerning those who bring a different doctrine?
options: Do not receive them into your house nor bid them God speed
Report them to the local synagogue
Ignore their teachings but show hospitality
questions.correctAnswer: Do not receive them into your house nor bid them God speed
questions.explanation: The verse instructs believers not to receive anyone who brings a different doctrine, nor to greet them with approval, as a safeguard against false teaching.

questions.question: The greeting 'Grace, mercy, and peace' in 2 John 1:3 mirrors which type of greeting commonly found in Pauline epistles?
options: A simple hello without theological significance
A traditional Jewish blessing for prosperity
questions.correctAnswer: Triadic greeting invoking divine blessings
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:3 includes a triadic greeting of grace, mercy, and peace, a common theological salutation in Pauline letters that invokes God’s blessings on the recipients.

questions.question: In 2 John 1:4, what is the reason for the elder's joy concerning the children of the elect lady?
options: They are walking in truth as commanded by the Father
They have fasted and prayed diligently
They have given generously to the poor
They have built a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: They are walking in truth as commanded by the Father
questions.explanation: The elder rejoices because the children are walking in truth according to the commandment received from the Father, showing faithfulness and obedience (2 John 1:4).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 John 1:12, the elder prefers to write lengthy letters rather than visit personally.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:12 states the elder would rather visit personally than write long letters, so that their joy may be complete.

questions.question: The phrase 'the truth's sake, which dwelleth in us' in 2 John 1:2 suggests what about the nature of truth in the believer's life?
options: Truth is indwelling and eternal within believers
Truth is only an external code of conduct
Truth changes according to cultural norms
Truth is exclusively found in the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: Truth is indwelling and eternal within believers
questions.explanation: Verse 2 John 1:2 describes truth as dwelling in believers and abiding forever, indicating an internal, permanent presence of divine truth.

questions.question: How does 2 John 1:11 relate to the concept of complicity in sin within the early Christian community?
options: By showing hospitality to deceivers, one becomes a partaker in evil deeds
By speaking against heretics publicly, one causes division
By giving money to false teachers, one supports ministry
By avoiding false teachers, one remains isolated
questions.correctAnswer: By showing hospitality to deceivers, one becomes a partaker in evil deeds
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:11 warns that anyone who greets or supports deceivers shares in their evil works, emphasizing communal responsibility for sin.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in the structure of 2 John 1:5-6, where love and obedience to commandments are closely linked?
options: Parallelism, linking love with walking in commandments
Chiasm, presenting love and commandments in inverted order
Metaphor, describing commandments as a path
Hyperbole, exaggerating the importance of love
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism, linking love with walking in commandments
questions.explanation: The passage uses parallelism to connect love with obedience to commandments, emphasizing that true love is demonstrated by following God's commands (2 John 1:5-6).

questions.question: Considering the historical context, why would the elder caution against receiving false teachers into one’s house as in 2 John 1:10?
options: Hospitality was a key cultural practice that could spread false doctrine
Homes were used as synagogues for official worship
Travel was so dangerous that travelers were rarely welcomed
False teachers were usually wealthy and exploited hosts financially
questions.correctAnswer: Hospitality was a key cultural practice that could spread false doctrine
questions.explanation: In the ancient Near East, hospitality was common and influential; thus, receiving false teachers into homes risked spreading heresy within the community (2 John 1:10).

questions.question: Which Old Testament commandment does the emphasis on 'love one another' in 2 John 1:5 echo, showing intertextual connection?
options: Numbers 6:24, 'The Lord bless you and keep you'
questions.correctAnswer: Leviticus 19:18, 'Love your neighbor as yourself'
questions.explanation: The command to love one another in 2 John 1:5 reflects the Leviticus 19:18 mandate to 'love your neighbor as yourself,' showing continuity in biblical ethics.

questions.question: How does 2 John 1:9 integrate Christological doctrine with soteriology in its warning?
options: Abiding in Christ’s doctrine equates to having both the Father and the Son, linking correct belief to salvation
Salvation is based solely on ethical behavior without doctrinal adherence
Christology is irrelevant to the believer’s relationship with God
One can have God without accepting Christ’s teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Abiding in Christ’s doctrine equates to having both the Father and the Son, linking correct belief to salvation
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:9 connects the doctrinal confession about Christ with the presence of both the Father and the Son, implying that true salvation includes correct Christology.

questions.question: Who sends greetings to the elect lady in 2 John 1:13, and what does this imply about early Christian fellowship?
options: The children of thy elect sister, indicating interconnected Christian communities
The apostles in Jerusalem, emphasizing apostolic authority
The Roman church elders, showing institutional control
The Gentile converts in Asia Minor, reflecting missionary work
questions.correctAnswer: The children of thy elect sister, indicating interconnected Christian communities
questions.explanation: The greeting from the children of the elect sister illustrates the familial and communal nature of early Christian fellowship (2 John 1:13).

theological.title: 2 John Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 John Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: To whom is the elder writing in 2 John 1:1?
options: The elect lady and her children
questions.correctAnswer: The elect lady and her children
questions.explanation: 2 John 1:1 identifies the recipient as the 'elect lady and her children,' emphasizing a specific beloved group known in the truth. This reflects the personal and communal nature of the letter, consistent with Paul's address to the elect in Titus 1:1 and the concept of God's chosen people in Deuteronomy 7:6.

questions.question: What reason does the elder give for loving the elect lady and her children in 2 John 1:1?
options: Because they are from the same city
questions.correctAnswer: Because they love the truth
questions.explanation: The elder expresses love 'in the truth' (2 John 1:1), highlighting the importance of truth in Christian love, echoing Jesus' teaching that truth and love are inseparable (John 14:6; 1 John 3:18; Ephesians 4:15).

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:3, from whom do grace, mercy, and peace come?
options: God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: This verse teaches the Trinitarian blessing of grace, mercy, and peace from both God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, affirming Christ's divine sonship and unity with the Father (John 1:14; Romans 1:7; Philippians 1:2; 2 Corinthians 13:14).

questions.question: What caused the elder great joy according to 2 John 1:4?
options: Finding the children walking in truth
questions.correctAnswer: Finding the children walking in truth
questions.explanation: The elder rejoiced because the children were walking in truth, which aligns with the biblical emphasis on living according to God's commandments (Psalm 119:30; John 8:31-32; 1 John 1:6-7; Galatians 5:16-25).

questions.question: What commandment does the elder remind the lady of in 2 John 1:5?
questions.correctAnswer: To love one another
questions.explanation: The elder refers to the commandment from the beginning to love one another, reflecting Jesus' teaching in John 13:34-35 and the Old Testament command in Leviticus 19:18, underscoring love as central to Christian ethics.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:6, what is the evidence of love?
questions.correctAnswer: Walking after His commandments
questions.explanation: Love is demonstrated by obedience to God's commandments, a theme consistent with Jesus' words in John 14:15, 1 John 5:3, and the holistic obedience taught throughout Scripture (Deuteronomy 6:5; Micah 6:8).

questions.question: Who does 2 John 1:7 identify as deceivers and antichrists?
options: Those who deny Jesus Christ came in the flesh
Those who oppose the Roman government
questions.correctAnswer: Those who deny Jesus Christ came in the flesh
questions.explanation: The verse warns against deceivers denying the incarnation, a critical Christological doctrine affirming Jesus' true humanity and divinity (John 1:14; 1 Timothy 3:16; Philippians 2:6-8; Hebrews 2:14).

questions.question: What caution does the elder give in 2 John 1:8 regarding the work already done?
options: To guard so we do not lose our labor
questions.correctAnswer: To guard so we do not lose our labor
questions.explanation: The elder urges vigilance so that the labor already accomplished is not lost, consistent with Paul's warnings in 1 Corinthians 9:27 and Hebrews 3:13 about persevering in faith and work.

questions.question: According to 2 John 1:9, what is the consequence for one who does not abide in the doctrine of Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: He hath not God
questions.explanation: The verse teaches the necessity of abiding in Christ's doctrine to have fellowship with God, reflecting Jesus' teaching on abiding in Him (John 15:4-6) and Paul's emphasis on sound doctrine (Titus 1:9).

questions.question: What instruction is given in 2 John 1:10 about receiving those who do not bring the doctrine of Christ?
options: Do not receive them into your house or bid them God speed
questions.correctAnswer: Do not receive them into your house or bid them God speed
questions.explanation: The elder instructs not to welcome or encourage those who deny Christ's doctrine, emphasizing the protection of the church from false teaching, in line with Paul's warnings in Romans 16:17 and Titus 3:10.

questions.question: Why should one not bid God speed to those who do not bring the doctrine of Christ, according to 2 John 1:11?
options: Because they become partakers of their evil deeds
questions.correctAnswer: Because they become partakers of their evil deeds
questions.explanation: The verse warns that encouraging false teachers makes one complicit in their wrongdoing, highlighting the seriousness of false teaching found also in 1 Timothy 5:22 and Galatians 5:9.

questions.question: How does the elder express his preference for communication in 2 John 1:12?
options: Prefers to speak face to face rather than write with paper and ink
questions.correctAnswer: Prefers to speak face to face rather than write with paper and ink
questions.explanation: The elder expresses a desire for personal fellowship to complete their joy, reflecting the biblical value placed on personal relationships (Acts 20:31; Hebrews 10:24-25; Philippians 2:1-4).

questions.question: Who sends greetings in 2 John 1:13?
options: The children of the elect sister
questions.correctAnswer: The children of the elect sister
questions.explanation: The greeting from the children of the elect sister shows the interconnectedness of believers, resembling greetings in other epistles like Romans 16:3-16 and 1 Corinthians 16:19.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'the truth dwelleth in us, and shall be with us forever' in 2 John 1:2 imply about the nature of truth?
options: The truth is permanent and indwells believers
questions.correctAnswer: The truth is permanent and indwells believers
questions.explanation: This verse affirms the indwelling and eternal nature of divine truth in believers, consistent with Jesus’ promise of the Spirit (John 14:17), the abiding Word (John 17:17), and the eternal counsel of God (Psalm 119:89).

questions.question: What does 2 John 1:6 teach about the relationship between love and obedience?
options: Love is shown by walking after God's commandments
questions.correctAnswer: Love is shown by walking after God's commandments
questions.explanation: The verse directly connects love with obedience, echoing Jesus' teaching in John 14:15 and the Old Testament's call to love God by keeping His statutes (Deuteronomy 6:5-6; 1 John 5:3).
